title: of the powers conferred on me by section 87 of the Merchant Shipping Act 2010
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Merchant Shipping (Health and
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Merchant Shipping (Health and 
Safety General Duties and Reporting of Marine Incidents) (Amendment) 
Regulations 2025.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited merchant shipping (health safety general duty reporting marine incidents) (amendment) regulation 2025

title: of the powers conferred on me by section 87 of the Merchant Shipping Act 2010
heading: 2. Regulation 12(2) of the Merchant Shipping (Health and Safety General
text_raw:
2. Regulation 12(2) of the Merchant Shipping (Health and Safety General 
Duties and Reporting of Marine Incidents) Regulations 2023 (S.I. No. 441 of 
2023) is amended by substituting for subparagraph (a) the following: 

“(a) take all reasonable precautions to prevent marine incidents and 
occupational hazards, injuries and diseases on board the ship, 
including through the provision of all necessary appropriately 
sized personal protective equipment and measures to reduce 
and prevent the risk of exposure to harmful levels of ambient 
factors and chemicals as well as the risk of injury or disease 
that may arise from the use of equipment and machinery on 
board the ship,”. 

GIVEN under my hand, 
 29 July 2025 

SEÁN CANNEY, 
 Minister of State at the Department of Transport. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 1st August, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [374] 3

title: of the powers conferred on me by section 87 of the Merchant Shipping Act 2010
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for the 2022 amendments to the Maritime Labour 
Convention 2006 in relation to health and safety and accident prevention. In 
particular, they set out the requirement for the shipowner to provide seafarers 
with the necessary appropriately sized personal protection equipment. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [374]
